title: Now you can get your copy of Office for Mac from Ascender
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421215137/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 16.Apr.2008 4.42pm 

Ascender Corp announced that Mac users who don’t have Office 2008 for Mac  
now have a source to acquire a legal copy of them:  
 [http://www.ascendercorp.com/pr/pr2008\_04\_17.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421215137/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/pr/pr2008_04_17.html "http://www.ascendercorp.com/pr/pr2008\_04\_17.html")

Office for Mac 2008 includes the Microsoft ClearType Font Collection - 24  
fonts including Calibri and Cambria. To ensure compatibility between Office  
suites, later this year Microsoft will release an update to Office 2004 for  
Mac with a free license for the fonts for use in Office 2004. But Mac users  
who don’t have Office and want the fonts for use in Corel, QuarkXPress and  
Adobe Creative Suite for design and publishing now have a way to license and  
download them.

More info on the Microsoft ClearType Fonts can be found here:  
 [http://www.ascendercorp.com/ctfonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080421215137/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/ctfonts.html "http://www.ascendercorp.com/ctfonts.html")
author: Miss Tiffany
